title: Effects of cash deposit at Fords Bank

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Greta opens a new checking account and deposits <math alttext="$5,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mtext>$5,000</mtext></mstyle></math> in cash at Ford Bank. The required reserve ratio is <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent, and the banking system has limited reserves.

(a) What is the amount by which Ford Bank’s liabilities have changed? Explain.

(b) Calculate the change in required reserves for Ford Bank. Show your work.

(c) What is the dollar value of the maximum amount of new loans Ford Bank can initially make from Greta’s deposit? Explain.

(d) As a result of Greta’s deposit, calculate the maximum amount by which the money supply can change throughout the banking system. Show your work.

(e) How will the change in the money supply in part (d) affect aggregate demand and unemployment in the short run? Explain.
